rules: Rule1: Either the company uses an automated system or the company has a manual process.
Rule2: Assuming the company has a manual process, then if the company has skilled staff, it results in the company producing a drug when it holds a manufacturing license.

Rule3: Given that the company maintains calibration, then whenever the company uses an automated system, it leads to the scenario where if the company has skilled staff, then holding a manufacturing license implies the company produces a drug.
Rule4: The company maintains calibration or the company neglects calibration.

Rule5: On the condition that the company neglects calibration, then if the company uses an automated system, it entails that should the company have skilled staff, then if the company holds a manufacturing license, the company produces a drug.
Rule6: If the company has contamination, then the company has a quality issue.
Rule7: Provided that the company implements sterilization, then if it is not the case that not being profitable implies having contamination, the company faces a lawsuit.
Rule8: The company implements sterilization or the company lacks sterilization.
Rule9: In cases where the company lacks sterilization, then if it is not the case that not being profitable implies having contamination, the company faces a lawsuit.
Rule10: Whenever the company produces a drug, the company is profitable.
Rule11: If the company continues operations, then it is not the case that the company gets shutdown.
Rule12: Provided that the company has GMP certification, the company has skilled staff.
Rule13: If it is not the case that either the company has an FDA warning or, if the company holds a manufacturing license, then the company produces a drug, then the company receives a fine.

Rule14: In the event that it is not the case that either the company has an FDA warning or, if the company holds a manufacturing license, then the company produces a drug, then it is not the case that the company receives a fine.
Rule15: If it is not the case that not being profitable implies having a quality issue, and this does not lead to the company passing inspection, then the company gets shutdown.
Rule16: Provided that it is not the case that not being profitable implies having a quality issue, and this does not result in the company passing inspection, then the company continues operations.
Rule17: Should it not be the case that not being profitable implies having a quality issue, then it is not the case that the company passes inspection.
facts: Fact1: The company holds a manufacturing license.
Fact2: The company has GMP certification.
Fact3: It is not the case that the company faces a lawsuit.
Fact4: It is not the case that the company has an FDA warning.
Fact5: It is not the case that the company has a quality issue.
